conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the x-t graph to determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second by identifying the slope of the line.
The image shows an x-t graph with a straight line starting from the origin (0,0) and moving upward and to the right. The line has a slope of 10 m/s.
The x-t graph represents the position of the car over time. The slope of the line on this graph indicates the car's speed.
The slope is given as 10 m/s, which means the car moves 10 meters per second.
Since the line is straight, the speed remains constant at 10 m/s throughout the time interval.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 10 m/s.
